se.overview:
MedTech's Software Engineering (SWE) program provides a combination of advanced technical and theoretical knowledge, best engineering practices, and emerging technologies to develop software that meet high quality standards.

The SE program is based on real-world learning experiences through team-centered, and hands-on projects to prepare students to become software architects and development team leaders. Moreover, the program helps students to acquire an entrepreneurial mindset by providing them with the required theoretical and practical knowledge of the entrepreneurial process and the practical steps to identify opportunities.

curriculum.subject: Web Development
curriculum.desc: Learn about full-stack development: learn to implement the website, its server and data base using the latest technology.

curriculum.subject: Operating Systems
curriculum.desc: Learn how operating systems manage to make your computer work. This course has some hardware aspects to it.

curriculum.subject: Global Software Development
curriculum.desc: Learn the history and the mindset behind open-source. Learn about open-source contributions, licensing, business models and more. Course offers several workshops.

curriculum.subject: Startup Engineering
curriculum.desc: Ever wondered how to launch a successful startup or start your own innovative business? This course if for you.

curriculum.subject: Introduction to Software Engineering
curriculum.desc: Learn about the discipline of software engineering: What's the job of a SE? What's expected of a SE? what are the techniques, methodologies and designs a SE should know?

curriculum.subject: Introduction to Management
curriculum.desc: Learn how to be a good project manager. Management is the act of getting people together to accomplish desired goals and objectives using available resources efficiently and effectively.

curriculum.subject: Graph Theory & Applications
curriculum.desc: Learn to use the power of graph theory to optimize any situation.

curriculum.subject: Database Management Systems
curriculum.desc: Learn to work with databases and how to integrate them in your projects.

curriculum.subject: Mobile Software Development
curriculum.desc: Learn to create websites suitable for smart phones, and mobile applications.

curriculum.subject: Requirements & User Experience
curriculum.desc: This is what comes after 'Introduction to Software Engineering' and the next step in you becoming a SE.

curriculum.subject: Governance & Citizenship
curriculum.desc: Improve your writing skills and introduce yourself to governance, citizenship and constitutional laws.

curriculum.subject: Junior Project
curriculum.desc: Use all what you learn during your junior year to make the best project you can.

curriculum.subject: Computer Networks
curriculum.desc: Learn how a set of computer connected by network nodes works and learn it's fundimentals.

curriculum.subject: Software Analysis & Design
curriculum.desc: It helps you understand the transformation of requirement specification into implementation.

curriculum.subject: Effective Technical Communication
curriculum.desc: You will learn tools and techniques that will help you communicate technical information more clearly.

curriculum.subject: Introduction to Finance
curriculum.desc: You will be introduced to the basic concepts needed to understand the financial manager's.

curriculum.subject: Distributed Systems
curriculum.desc: Get familiar with a computing environment in which various components are spread across multiple computers on a network.

curriculum.subject: Senior Project
curriculum.desc: Use all what you learn during your senior year to make the best project you can.

curriculum.subject: Software Architecture
curriculum.desc: Simply you will learn the organization of a system.

curriculum.subject: Software Development Methodologies
curriculum.desc: learn and get familiar with the methodologies used for software development.

curriculum.subject: Engineering Ethics & Professional Pratice
curriculum.desc: Get familiar with the ethics of an engineer and his professional practice.

curriculum.subject: Artificial Intelligence
curriculum.desc: Learn the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think like humans and mimic their actions.

curriculum.subject: Software Quality and Testing
curriculum.desc: Learn the methods of testing and finding out the quality of software.

curriculum.subject: Programming Language Design & Implementation
curriculum.desc: To learn the design and implementation of modern programming languages.

curriculum.subject: Cyber Security Assessment & Management
curriculum.desc: Learn to examine an organization's IT infrastructure and analyzes the ability of established security controls to remediate vulnerabilities.

curriculum.subject: Data Analytics
curriculum.desc: Learn the science of analyzing raw data to make conclusions about that information.

curriculum.subject: Pervasive Computing & Cloud
curriculum.desc: Learn the growing trend of embedding computational capability into everyday objects to make them effectively communicate.

curriculum.subject: Research Methods
curriculum.desc: Learn a set of procedures or techniques used to identify, select, process, and analyze information about a topic.

curriculum.subject: Machine Learning
curriculum.desc: Learn a type of artificial intelligence (AI) that allows software applications to become more accurate at predicting outcomes.

curriculum.subject: Capstone Project
curriculum.desc: Use all what you learn during all years to make the best project you can to graduate.

se.outcomes:
As a SE Student, you should expect to gain:

   - Ability to understand and work with multiple programming languages, frameworks and libraries.

   - Ability to work in one or more significant application domains.

   - Ability to apply the software engineering lifecycle by demonstrating competence in communication, planning, analysis, design, construction, and deployment.

   - Ability to work as an individual and as part of a multidisciplinary team.

   - Ability to demonstrate agility in solving software challenges.

   - An ability to identify, formulate, and solve CSE problems.

   - An ability to lead a team and function within a team.

   - An understanding of professional and ethical responsibility.

   - An ability to communicate effectively.

   - All ABET Student Outcomes.
se.opportunities:
- Applications & Web Development.
- The 'Internet Of Things' field.
- Artificial Intelligence.
- Security, Cloud and Data Science.
- Game Development.
- Research & Testing of Software Systems.
- Freelancing and Consulting.
se.requirements:
To enroll in this program, you should have completed the common core pre-engineering program, or have completed an equivalent level of study such as: License, Two years of preparatory studies...

If you want to excel at this program, you should have relatively good grades in Mathematics and coding courses like Object Oriented Programming. Consider taking our Program Compatibility Quiz to know which programs may suit you and your personality.

cse.overview:
The CSE program is based on real-world learning experiences through team-centered and hands-on projects to provide students with the required knowledge and skills. Moperreover, the program helps students to acquire an entrepreneurial mindset by providing them with the required theoretical and practical knowledge of the entrepreneurial process and the practical steps to identify opportunities.

After the completion of the program with 210 credits of which 126 credits are in the main field of study, an engineering degree certificate is issued with a major in Computer Systems.

cse.outcomes:
As a CSE Student, you should expect to gain:

   - An ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science and engineering.

   - An ability to design and conduct experiments, as well as to analyze and interpret data.

   - An ability to design a system, component, or process to meet desired needs within realistic constraints such as economic, environmental, social, political, ethical, health and safety, manufacturability, and sustainability.

   - An ability to coordinate between Software & Hardware components.

   - An ability to identify, formulate, and solve CSE problems.

   - An ability to lead a team and function within a team.

   - An understanding of professional and ethical responsibility.

   - An ability to communicate effectively.

   - All ABET Student Outcomes.
cse.opportunities:
- Hardware & Embedded System Development.
- The 'Internet Of Things' field.
- Automation & Robotics.
- Security, Cloud and Data Science.
- Networks & Telecommunications.
- Research & System Integration.
cse.requirements:
To enroll in this program, you should have completed the common core pre-engineering program, or have completed an equivalent level of study such as: License, Two years of preparatory studies...

If you want to excel at this program, you should have relatively good grades in Mathematics and Electrical/Computer related courses and lab sessions. A decent programming knowledge is a plus. Consider taking our Program Compatibility Quiz to know which programs may suit you and your personality.

re.overview:
MedTech's Renewable Energy Engineering (REE) program provides a combination of advanced technical and theoretical knowledge in the rapidly expanding area of renewable energy engineering with a clear Electrical Engineering focus.

The REE program is based on real-world learning experiences through team-centered, and hands-on projects to provide students with the required knowledge and skills to assess renewable energy resources, design appropriate renewable energy systems, evaluate the performance of these systems and assess the wider impacts of renewable energy development. Moreover, the program helps students to acquire an entrepreneurial mindset by providing them with the required theoretical and practical knowledge of the entrepreneurial process and the practical steps to identify opportunities.

re.outcomes:
As a RE Student, you should expect to gain:

   - An ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, physics, chemistry and electrical engineering.

   - An ability to work on and conduct experiments, as well as to analyze and interpret data.

   - An ability to design a system, component, or process to meet desired needs within realistic constraints such as economic, environmental, social, political, ethical, health and safety, manufacturability, and sustainability.

   - An ability to conduct research and produce technical reports and writings.

   - An ability to negotiate and communicate with people from different educational backgrounds.

   - An ability to lead a team and function within a team.

   - An understanding of professional and ethical responsibility.

   - An ability to communicate effectively.

   - All ABET Student Outcomes.
re.opportunities:
- Design & Development of renewable energy technologies.
- Site and ground condition inspections renewable energy sites.
- Lab experiments & Research.
- Usage of mathematical modelling to produce estimates.
- Environmental project plans & environmental laws.
- Testing, Technical Writing & Consulting.
- Business, Management & Negotiations with providers, contractors.
re.requirements:
To enroll in this program, you should have completed the common core pre-engineering program, or have completed an equivalent level of study such as: License, Two years of preparatory studies...

If you want to excel at this program, you should have relatively good grades in Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry. A good understanding of electrical circuits is a plus. Consider taking our Program Compatibility Quiz to know what programs may suit you and your personality.
